mission: We partner with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations. We create customized data systems for these healthc...
theoryOfChange: Hikma Health partners with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations to create customized data systems for these healthcare providers to improve patient outcomes; empowers patients and physicians with accessible, secure, actionable health data and data-driven tools, enabling continuity of care and better clinical decisions.

grantsData.purpose: Grant to Parkers Mobile Clinic, a non profit in Nigeria providing healthcare services to deploy the Hikma Health EHR system.

While the cause urgency is high, the overall alignment score reflects a need for more extensive historical data to establish a long-term track record [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact potential through systemic change, utilizing a cost-effective model to provide health data systems to underserved populations [1]. With a 100.0% program expense ratio and significant working capital of 26.0 months, the charity shows strong financial health and a direct commitment to its mission [2].

In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $70,494 while maintaining a focus on technological integration in Latin America and beyond [2].

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the <cite id="13">theory of change is clear</cite>, the organization has <cite id="12">unverified evidence and outcomes</cite> from external evaluators.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By deploying EHR and HERS systems, Hikma Health enables clinics to collect better data, leading to improved clinical decision-making and better health outcomes for refugees.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that digital tools actually lead to better patient health in resource-constrained environments.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="17">revenue of only $70,494</cite> and a <cite id="11">declining growth rate</cite>, the organization has a significant funding gap to reach its scaling goals.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">1.0% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, a rare level of efficiency in the global health sector.
Hikma Health reports a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating that no donor funds are diverted to professional fundraising costs.
The charity maintains <cite id="8">26.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability for its long-term tech deployments.

strengths_deep_dive: Hikma Health's operational model is built on extreme fiscal leanliness and high-impact systemic change. By maintaining a <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, they outperform the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 84.6%</cite> for global health organizations. This efficiency is further supported by their <cite id="10">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, which reflects their commitment to sharing organizational data. Their ability to operate with <cite id="7">zero fundraising costs</cite> suggests a model heavily reliant on grants or board-supported operations, allowing public donations to go entirely toward <cite id="6">EHR deployment and care innovation</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. is a specialized health technology nonprofit that empowers healthcare providers in underserved regions through <cite id="1">customized data systems and innovative health technology</cite>. The organization focuses on creating and deploying open-source digital tools, such as the <cite id="2">Health and Environmental Record System (HERS)</cite>, to improve clinical outcomes for refugee and vulnerable populations. In the 2023 fiscal year, Hikma Health reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $70,494</cite>, operating as a lean, tech-driven entity. Despite its modest budget, the organization maintains an exceptional <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 100.0%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar donated is directed toward its mission of technological integration in healthcare. Their work spans critical areas including <cite id="5">COVID-19 policy data mapping and implementation science research</cite>, primarily serving regions like Nicaragua. By providing the digital infrastructure necessary for modern medicine, Hikma Health enables local clinics to transition from paper-based records to <cite id="6">Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems</cite>, which facilitates better patient tracking and data-driven care in crisis zones.
